else if (useItemID == id && atObjectID == object id) { sendMessage("message"); addSkillXP((0*playerLevel[1]), 1); startAnimation(894); deleteItem(id,getItemSlot(id), 1); deleteItem(995, getItemSlot(995), 30000); addItem(id, 1); } else { sendMessage("You don't have 30K!"); } }

item.title: How would i

item.description:
@andrew1234321 wrote:

lets say that I want to use a peice of food, with the range, but If I don’t have lets say 20k in my inventory, It wont let me cook it (this is just an example)

ik it will look like this

else if (useItemID == id && atObjectID == object id) { sendMessage("message"); addSkillXP((0*playerLevel[1]), 1); startAnimation(894); deleteItem(id,getItemSlot(id), 1); deleteItem(995, getItemSlot(995), 30000); addItem(id, 1); }

covered some of it up tho cuz i didn’t want people stealing parts of my code…

what would i add to make it so that nothing happens if they dont have 30k in this case?
